CREATE FUNCTION [ManualBill].[DeterminActualDate]
(
	@OriginalAccountNumber varchar(15),
	@FromOrTo varchar(1), -- T: ToDate; F: FromDate
	@BillingPeriod varchar(6), -- billing period revision
	@BillingCycle varchar(1) -- M:montly, B:bimonthly
)
RETURNS varchar(8)
AS
begin
-- =============================================
-- Author:		Mohammed Belarrem
-- Create date: 03/12/2009 
-- Update date: 06/15/2009 :    Added LA check 
--								this ensures that if record is LA then it is not trusted wth to and FROM otherwise use it since it has been updated	
-- Update date: 09/29/2009 :    Added LA check to the condition that checks the previous period 
--								this ensures that if record is LA then it is not trusted wth to and FROM otherwise use it since it has been updated	
--						   :	Also corrected the To section. the it was grabbing the ToDate of the next period instead of the FromDate
-- Description:	Get actual FromDate/ToDate for a given period
-- =============================================

	declare @returnDate varchar(8)

	/****************************
		Get FromDate
	****************************/
	if(@FromOrTo = 'F')
	begin -- begin get FromDate

		-- check if you have actual fromDate for the given period
		select @returnDate = FromDate
		from 
		Billing.AccountBilling
		where 
		OriginalAccountNumber in 
			(select OriginalAccountNumber from Billing.Account 
				where CurrentAccountNumber =
				(select top 1 CurrentAccountNumber 
				from Billing.Account where OriginalAccountNumber = @OriginalAccountNumber ))
		and 
		AccountBillingStatus <> 'LA'
		and
		BillingPeriodRevision = @BillingPeriod
		and
		FromDate is not null 
		and 
		FromDate <> '18760101'
		and 
		FromDate <> ''
		
		/*
			If there is not FromDate for the given period, check for toDate of the previous period
		*/
		if(@returnDate is null)
		begin -- get toDate of the previous period
			
			declare @previousPeriod varchar(6)
			select @previousPeriod = dbo.CreatePreviousPeriod(@BillingPeriod,  @BillingCycle)
			select @returnDate = 
				ToDate from	Billing.AccountBilling
				where 
				OriginalAccountNumber in 
						(select OriginalAccountNumber from Billing.Account 
						 where CurrentAccountNumber =
						(select top 1 CurrentAccountNumber 
						from Billing.Account where OriginalAccountNumber = @OriginalAccountNumber ) ) 
				and 
				AccountBillingStatus <> 'LA'
				and
				BillingPeriodRevision = @previousPeriod		
				and
				ToDate is not null 
				and 
				ToDate <> '18760101'
				and 
				ToDate <> ''
		end -- end get toDate of the previous period
	end -- end get FromDate


	/****************************
		Get ToDate
	****************************/
	if(@FromOrTo = 'T')	
	begin -- begin get ToDate
		select @returnDate 
			= ToDate from Billing.AccountBilling
		where 
		OriginalAccountNumber in 
			(select OriginalAccountNumber from Billing.Account 
				where CurrentAccountNumber =
				(select top 1 CurrentAccountNumber 
				from Billing.Account where OriginalAccountNumber = @OriginalAccountNumber ))
		and 
		AccountBillingStatus <> 'LA'
		and
		BillingPeriodRevision = @BillingPeriod		
		and
		ToDate is not null 
		and 
		ToDate <> '18760101'
		and 
		ToDate <> ''

		/*
			If there is not toDate for the given period, check for fromDate of the next period
		*/
		if(@returnDate is null)
		begin -- get fromDate of the next period
			declare @nextPeriod varchar(6)
			select @nextPeriod = dbo.CreateNextPeriod(@BillingPeriod,  @BillingCycle)
			
			select @returnDate = 
				FromDate from	Billing.AccountBilling
				where 
				OriginalAccountNumber in 
					(select OriginalAccountNumber from Billing.Account 
						where CurrentAccountNumber =
						(select top 1 CurrentAccountNumber 
						from Billing.Account where OriginalAccountNumber = @OriginalAccountNumber  ))
				and 
				AccountBillingStatus <> 'LA'
				and
				BillingPeriodRevision = @nextPeriod		
				and
				ToDate is not null 
				and 
				ToDate <> '18760101'
				and 
				ToDate <> ''
		end -- end get fromDate of the next period
	end -- end get ToDate
	
	return @returnDate
		
END
